question_sentence: Which airline announced it is suspending service at New York’s JFK Airport, saying its schedule is too small to remain competitive?
evidence: United Airlines is temporarily halting service at JFK beginning October 29, the company announced.

question_sentence: Which new product did Tesla debut at an event this week?
evidence: Tesla’s new robot, dubbed Optimus, walked on stage at the company’s AI Day, slowly waved at the crowd and gestured with its hands for about one minute.

question_sentence: The devastation wrought by Hurricane Ian likely caused how much in damages?
evidence: Initial damages from the deadly storm are estimated to be more than $50 billion – and also dinged overall US economic output, economists say.

question_sentence: An independent investigation released this week found systemic abuse and misconduct within which women’s professional sport in the US?
evidence: The investigation found multiple allegations or findings of sexual harassment and misconduct by head coaches of several women’s professional soccer teams.

question_sentence: SpaceX and NASA launched a rocket into space Wednesday. What was its destination?
evidence: SpaceX and NASA launched a crew of astronauts to the International Space Station. The mission marks a significant moment in history, as astronaut Nicole Mann became the first Native American woman ever to travel to space. She’s also serving as mission commander, making her the first woman ever to take on such a role for a SpaceX mission.

question_sentence: Beloved singer Loretta Lynn died this week at age 90. Which music genre was she best known for?
evidence: Loretta Lynn, the “Coal Miner’s Daughter,” scored several hits with fiery country songs that topped the charts in 1966.

question_sentence: New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge hit a record-breaking 62nd home run this week. Who holds the overall major league single-season record with 73 home runs?
evidence: While Judge broke Roger Maris’ single-season American League home run record, Barry Bonds holds the major league record with 73 home runs in 2001. However, many have cast doubt on that landmark given that Bonds was embroiled in a performance-enhancing drug scandal and allegedly used steroids. Bonds has denied those allegations.

question_sentence: Which country announced a new plan this week to prevent any more animal species from reaching extinction?
evidence: Australia, which has one of the world’s worst records for extinctions, has committed to protecting 30% of its land and 30% of its ocean by 2030.

question_sentence: Which state announced it is legalizing jaywalking?
evidence: Californians will soon be able to cross the street outside of a formal intersection without being ticketed – as long as it’s safe to do so. The new law signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom will take effect on January 1.

question_sentence: Which country’s polarizing presidential race will go to a second round run-off after no candidate achieved a majority of more than 50% of the ballot this week?
evidence: Brazil’s heated presidential election will go to second round. This comes after more than 123 million Brazilians waited in long lines to vote in the world’s fourth largest democracy.

question_sentence: Aaron Judge hit his 62nd home run of the season this week, breaking a 61-year-old American League record previously held by:
Native American activist and actress Sacheen Littlefeather died this week. She famously declined an Oscar on behalf of which actor?
A new character was added to the M&Ms lineup for the first time in over a decade. What color is she?
In a historic move, President Joe Biden announced he is pardoning people with federal convictions for what charge?
To celebrate the 60th anniversary of a major single, two previously unseen photos of what iconic band were released this week?
A pumpkin in which state set a new record as the heaviest in US history?
The rapper formerly known as Kanye West made a big statement at Paris Fashion Week. What was on his clothing that sparked backlash?
An angry mob of anglers was seen on viral video assailing two men who tried to cheat at a fishing tournament by doing what?
choices: Stocking the lake ahead of time

question_sentence: Guinness World Records named Fenrir Antares Powers, a 2-year-old Savannah cat, the tallest living domestic cat. He measures:
Loretta Lynn, a Kentucky coal miner’s daughter who became a country music legend, died this week at 90. Which of these is not one of her songs?
choices: "You Ain't Woman Enough (To Take My Man)"

question_sentence: Greenpeace campaigners who disrupted Liz Truss’s Tory conference speech held a sign saying what?
evidence: The protesters accused the prime minister of “shredding” her party’s election manifesto by U-turning on fracking and climate action

question_sentence: A first edition of which Jane Austen novel sold for £375,000 at auction this week?
evidence: Published in 1815, the three-volumn edition of Emma includes a handwritten message from Austen and achieved the highest price ever paid for any printed work by the author

question_sentence: The newly launched European Political Community is the brainchild of which national leader?
evidence: Leaders from 44 countries – including all 27 EU member states – met in Prague this week for the first summit of the new political forum of nations

question_sentence: North Korea this week test-fired a ballistic missile over which country for the first time since 2017?
evidence: Pyongyang triggered panic on Tuesday by firing an intermediate-range missile an estimated 4,600km (2,860 miles) over Japan into the Pacific Sea, in the first test launch over the enemy nation in five years

question_sentence: Academics have criticised Steve Coogan’s new film The Lost King for allegedly doing what?
choices: Being filmed in historically inaccurate locations
Mixing up the dates of Richard III’s reign
Overplaying the work of an amateur historian
evidence: Academics involved in the discovery of King Richard III’s remains in a Leicester car park in 2012 claim the film gives too much credit to Philippa Langley, a history buff who became obsessed with finding the lost monarch

question_sentence: Kanye West sparked controversy this week by doing what at Paris Fashion Week?
choices: Publicly propositioning his ex-mother-in-law, Kris Jenner
Announcing his candidacy in the US presidential election in 2024
Wearing a shirt with the slogan ‘White Lives Matter’
Kissing model Kendall Jenner, the sister of his ex Kim Kardashian
evidence: The rapper and designer is facing criticism for wearing the controversial T-shirt and sending black models down the runway in clothing bearing the slogan at his Yeezy label fashion show

question_sentence: Which of the following are among six high-profile figures taking legal action against the Daily Mail’s publisher over what they describe as ‘gross breaches of privacy’?
evidence: Prince Harry, Doreen Lawrence, Sadie Frost, Elton John and his partner David Furnish are also taking legal action against Associated Newspapers over alleged phone-tapping and privacy breaches

question_sentence: Which Asian destination is giving away 500,000 free airline tickets in a bid to boost tourism following the pandemic?
evidence: Hong Kong authorities are giving away HK$2bn (£224.3m) worth of flights as part of a push to increase visitor numbers to pre-Covid levels

question_sentence: A new study has suggested that images posted on Instagram are causing new mothers extra stress by doing what?
choices: Pushing breast feeding as the only option
evidence: The study, published in the journal Healthcare, found new mothers’ mental health could be at risk due to unrealistic images of postpartum bodies

question_sentence: King Charles has reportedly been asked by Liz Truss not to attend this year’s Cop27 climate conference, which is being held where?
evidence: Alok Sharmer, president of last year’s summit, has urged Truss to allow the King to attend the summit with her next month,  following reports that the prime minister had advised Charles to stay away
